Fast Pool memory allocator.

/details pool_allocator is a more general-purpose solution, geared towards efficiently servicing requests for any number of contiguous chunks. fast_pool_allocator is also a general-purpose solution, but is geared towards efficiently servicing requests for one chunk at a time; it will work for contiguous chunks, but not as well as pool_allocator. If you are seriously concerned about performance, use fast_pool_allocator when dealing with containers such as std::list, and use pool_allocator when dealing with containers such as std::vector.
